column4: I am having trouble untarring files via terminal in kubuntu 10.10
it just sais: tar(child) error is not recoverable: exiting now
first it sais cannot find such file/directory
Tell me (copy/paste) the actual command that you are trying to use.
you are not telling it where to store the tar file ...
do "tar xvfz /a/* fil.tgz" as an example to save all in that subdir tofil.tgz.
You werecorrectin what you wrote, butyou didn't tell it where toput the results.

I need some help troubleshooting NFS mounting my NAS. It's been a while since I played with NFS, but I THINK that it is correct. I believe that NFS is running properly on the NAS, 'cause I can do showmount -e NAS and it shows the four FS mounts on the server. I created a place to mount on my client, and it is looking right and with owner/group as root. However when I do ...
sudo mount -o soft,intr,rsize=8192,wsize=8192 sunshine:/mnt/disk1 /sunshine nothing happens and it times out.
